Whether you're aiming to improve your backend skills, work with databases, or prepare for technical interviews, this roadmap provides a clear and practical learning path.
A visual roadmap with progress tracking is also available to help you stay organized and motivated.

Goal: Understand the basics of relational databases and SQL syntax.  
What is SQL and its importance

articles.author: Mehwish Malik
articles.description:
Most B2B Devs Think They're Safe From Cookie Laws (Spoiler: They're Not)


Here's the thing nobody tells you: B2B websites get hit with privacy fines just as hard as consumer sites.
I used to think, "We're B2B, we don't need cookie consent banners." Then I saw the headlines about companies getting slapped with ‚Ç¨50K+ fines for missing consent on their lead generation sites.
Turns out, if you're using Google Analytics, LinkedIn tracking, or any marketing tools on your B2B site, you need proper cookie consent. Period.
Your "professional" website is probably doing this right now:
Tracking visitor behavior without consent
Running marketing pixels in the background

Collecting emails through forms with hidden tracking
Assuming business users don't care about privacy
Plot twist: Business users are still people with privacy rights.
Instead of spending weeks learning GDPR legalese, smart B2B teams are using AI-powered tools like Seers AI (https://seers.ai/) to handle everything automatically.
It scans your site, finds every tracking cookie (even the sneaky ones), and generates compliant consent banners that actually convert leads instead of scaring them away.
Get compliant: Try Seers AI free ‚Üí https://seers.ai/
Make money: Join their referral program ‚Üí 15% commission + 15% discount for referrals
Help fellow devs: Share this with your network (and earn from it)
Think about it: every B2B dev you know needs this. You solve their compliance headache, they save money, and you get paid.
Privacy regulations aren't getting looser. B2B companies are getting hit with bigger penalties every year.
You can either become a privacy law expert (boring) or let AI handle it while you focus on building cool stuff (much better).
For more details, visit our comprehensive article: B2B Cookie Consent Compliance Guide
articles.title: Future-Proofing Your B2B Web Apps: Why Cookie Consent Is No Longer a 'Set It and Forget It' Task.

articles.author: youming666
articles.description:
Hi everyone‚ÄîI'm brand new to dev.to and excited to share a little side project I‚Äôve been working on! I‚Äôm passionate about indie party games, particularly‚ÄØGuilty‚ÄØas‚ÄØSock, that hilarious sock-puppet courtroom experience. So I built the Guilty as Sock Hub, a free toolkit to enhance your sessions with:
A character generator and evidence card creator


Game-tracker to log trials and outcomes
In-depth strategy guides to master courtroom chaos 
This game is a riot on its own‚Äîbut I wanted something to streamline the setup, spark new storylines, and help players track progress over time. The site does just that, aiming to enrich the fun without being a chore.
I‚Äôm not just dropping a link‚ÄîI wanted to share the why and how. If you've ever wished for quick tools to generate characters or evidence cards mid-game, I hope you'll find it useful. Feel free to check it out live at Guilty as Sock Game Hub
 when you have a moment!
As a new member of this community, I‚Äôm looking forward to contributing more‚Äîwhether it's game-driven tools, indie dev tips, or insights from building side projects. I‚Äôd love your feedback: what‚Äôs working, what‚Äôs confusing, what‚Äôs next?
**Thanks for reading! **Looking forward to connecting, learning, and sharing more tech-heavy but fun efforts soon.
articles.title: Introducing Guilty as Sock Hub: Tools and Strategies for Your Party Game

Artificial Intelligence (AI) continues to dominate the tech investment landscape in 2025, marking one of the most exciting and transformative phases in the industry. With innovation accelerating across machine learning, autonomous agents, and generative models, investors worldwide are backing AI with unprecedented enthusiasm. Despite broader market volatility, AI remains a prime focus of global funding activity.
Unprecedented Global Investment
In Q1 2025 alone, global venture capital investments surged past $80 billion, with over 86% of this allocated to AI-focused ventures. A record-breaking $40 billion transaction‚Äîled by major players like OpenAI‚Äîmarked a pivotal moment in tech history, solidifying investor confidence in large-scale AI models and enterprise-ready applications.
North Amer‚Ä¶
articles.title: AI Funding and Developments: Navigating the 2025 Landscape

articles.author: Abhay Chaturvedi
articles.description:
Artificial Intelligence: A Powerful Yet Underutilized Tool
Artificial Intelligence (AI) has evolved from being just a futuristic concept to a core driver of modern business transformation. Organizations across different industries are using AI to enhance customer experiences, automate operations, and extract valuable insights from vast datasets.
AI adoption has reached a record-breaking level, with 72% of firms incorporating AI into their strategic plans. However, despite this surge, many companies struggle to unlock AI‚Äôs full potential. A staggering 30% of AI projects fail to progress beyond the proof-of-concept (POC) stage; never achieving real-world impact.
So, if AI is so powerful, why do so many initiatives fail to deliver real impact?
Read: A Detailed Guide to Boosting ROI with AI-Op‚Ä¶
articles.title: Unlocking The Power of AI: Everyday AI for Business Transformation

articles.author: Molly Scott
articles.description:
Every time a person lands on your website, they begin a path. This path is made of many small choices. These are called micro-decisions. They include clicking a button, reading a paragraph, watching a video, or filling a form. Each one moves the user closer to or further from what you want them to do‚Äîlike buying a product or signing up for a service.
When these choices are easy, smooth, and feel natural, we say the funnel is ‚Äúfrictionless.‚Äù A good funnel helps people make the right choice without thinking too hard. It keeps them on your site, increases engagement, and improves Search engine optimization results.
This blog explains how to build frictionless funnels using micro-decisions. It shows how this helps your SEO by boosting key metrics like bounce rate, time on page, and conversions‚Ä¶
articles.title: Frictionless Funnels: Designing for Micro-Decisions That Boost SEO Metrics

articles.author: DCT Technology Pvt. Ltd.
articles.description:
Imagine debugging a program, but the variables hold multiple values at once.
Or securing an app with encryption that even the fastest supercomputer can‚Äôt crack‚Äîbut a quantum one might.
Welcome to the quantum era. It‚Äôs no longer sci-fi. It‚Äôs coming fast, and if you‚Äôre a developer, the time to pay attention is now.
Whether you're into web dev, DevOps, or AI‚Äîquantum computing is going to disrupt everything from security to search.
Let‚Äôs decode what you really need to know as a developer üëá

Unlike classical computers that process bits (0s and 1s), quantum computers use qubits‚Äîquantum bits that can be 0 and 1 at the same time thanks to a principle called superposition.
And when qubits become entangled (yep, another real quantum principle), changing one affects the other instantly‚Äîeven across d‚Ä¶
articles.title: Quantum Computing 101: Why Every Developer Should Pay Attention Right¬†Now

articles.author: Pratiksha Patil
articles.description:
As developers, we think we know how users interact with our apps. We make educated guesses, run emulator tests, and roll out A/B experiments, hoping something sticks.
But here‚Äôs the truth: real users behave differently from our test assumptions. And unless we‚Äôre testing on actual devices in real-world conditions, we‚Äôre missing critical insights.
Emulators are fast and accessible, but they‚Äôre also idealized environments. They don‚Äôt capture:
Real touch interactions
Network fluctuations
Device-specific rendering quirks
Battery/power impacts on performance
In production, these things matter ,  a lot. That floating button that worked perfectly on your dev machine might be half-clipped on a mid-range Android.
A/B testing works, but only if it‚Äôs based on how users experience your app. If you're running tests without accounting for real device behavior, your insights are limited. You might think layout B is outperforming layout A, when in reality, layout A simply loaded faster on most users' devices.
Here‚Äôs where platforms like NativeBridge come in. They help developers test UI changes directly on real devices as well as emulators ‚Äî and collect deep interaction metrics like:
Tap heatmaps
Scroll behavior
UI responsiveness on specific models
Performance differences across OS versions
What This Looks Like in Practice
Imagine you're testing a new onboarding screen. With NativeBridge:
You deploy both versions (A/B) across a fleet of real devices.
You track how users actually interact ‚Äî where they drop off, where they get stuck, how long animations take to render.
You optimize not just for clicks, but for fluid, device-native experiences.
The feedback loop becomes faster, smarter, and grounded in reality.
TL;DR
These tools make it possible to run scalable, UI-first A/B tests on actual devices. And once you do that, your app gets better ‚Äî not just in theory, but where it counts: on your users‚Äô screens.
articles.title: Developers, Stop Guessing , Real Users Are Telling You What Works

articles.author: AuthX
articles.description:
In today‚Äôs digital age, protecting sensitive information and ensuring secure access to systems is more important than ever. One of the most advanced and reliable methods of securing access is biometric security. This article will explore what biometric security is, how it integrates with Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA), and the role of Single Sign-On (SSO) login systems in streamlining secure access.
What is Biometric Security?
what is biometric security
Biometric security offers several advantages:
Uniqueness: Biometric features are unique to each person, making it difficult for someone else to replicate or fake.
Convenience: Users don‚Äôt need to remember complex passwords.
Speed: Authentication is often quick, requiring just a scan or a glance.
Common applications of biometric security ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Biometric Security: MFA & SSO Explained for Secure Access
